document.title: SP563-Poultry Litter Sampling and Testing

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: Since cleaning and litter disposal may be needed only once a year for poultry houses, the time and expense for having a sample tested is minimal. The savings in fertilizer costs will more than compensate for the litter analysis cost. In addition, the reduced risk of overfertilization and potential water contamination should make litter sampling and testing worthwhile.
